context.description: Select the Create XML file from a DTD file radio button to create an XML file from a DTD file. The file will contain the selected root element, populated with any required elements and attributes.

Select the Create XML file from an XML schema file radio button to create an XML file from an XML schema. The file will contain the selected root element of the XML schema and any elements or attributes it contains.

topic.label: Generating XML files from XML schemas

context.description: Select the Create XML file from scratch radio button if you want to create an XML file not associated with any XML schema or DTD file.

Select the Select file from workbench radio button if you want to create your XML file from a DTD or XML schema that is in the workbench.
Select the Select XML Catalog entry radio button if you want to use a file listed in the XML Catalog to create your XML file.

The root element of an XML file is the element that contains all other elements in that file. All elements defined in the DTD or all global elements defined in the XML schema are included in this list.
Note: If you do not have any elements in your DTD or any global elements in your XML schema, you cannot create an XML file from it.
